reviews.text: Babylon’s Fall is a baffling game that lacks any distinct vision, both in terms of gameplay and artistic design.
Platinum Games’s name is a seal of quality, but Babylon’s Fall is proof even the best studios can fail.
Babylon’s Fall feels like a live service cash grab with no cohesive vision.
Combat feels sluggish and unresponsive compared to Platinum’s past games.
The oil painting aesthetic makes the game muddy and unfocused.
Character models look like they’re from a mobile game.
The character creator offers few skin tone options for players wanting diverse characters.
Combat grows repetitive quickly.
The soundtrack has memorable orchestral themes.
The story fails to deliver on any interesting themes it sets up.
The Gideon Coffin system is never fully realized.
Daily missions and battle pass challenges force grinding.
The game’s aesthetic choices are baffling.
Combat lacks the flair of Platinum’s past titles like Metal Gear Rising.

The game requires a complete overhaul to be salvageable.
